page.title: 10The Railway at Acklington
page.content: {Acklington Station}is no longer the thriving station it once was. The line is busy with High Speed 125 trains running between London and Edinburgh, but only 6 trains stop each day at our station (3 going north, 3 going south) and few people get on or off. Perhaps the occasional visitor for the prison, or the inmate on his release day, or a family going shopping to Newcastle, but certainly not the numbers using the trains as there used to be. The old station itself, which was falling into disrepair, has been privately bought and is now a dwelling house. {The Railway Inn,}owned by Scottish & Newcastle Breweries, is open 7 days a week from 11 a.m.-3 p.m. and 7-11 p.m. Two people work there, the busiest days are Tuesdays & Thursdays (mart days) and the most popular drinks are lager, scotch (whisky) and rum.
